Description.val:
The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $.115 million to reflect the Department of Navy's effort to support the Office of Management and Budget directed reforms for Efficiency and Effectiveness that include a lean, accountable, more efficient government.

Funding in this P-1 line provides for the procurement of tactical Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) equipment that will be installed aboard ships and in the facilities at the TRIDENT Refit Facility (TRIREFFAC), Navy Intermediate Maintenance Facility (NAVIMFAC) and TRIDENT Training Facility (TRITRAFAC).  The TRIDENT Refit Facility and Navy Intermediate Maintenance Facility (NAVIMFAC) are dedicated shore support facilities providing a full range of industrial support.  The TRITRAFAC provides the crews for the OHIO Class (SSBN/SSGN) Submarines with realistic training experience in operating and maintaining shipboard equipment. The growth in this line is due to procurement and installation of OHIO CLASS Ship Control Station Obsolete Equipment Replacement (SCS OER).   In FY18 to FY19 the number of procurements increases from 1 to 3 and Ship installations increase from 3 to 4.  Also, FY19 includes installation of  shore based systems, including associated design and engineering,  at  maintenance activities (LAB) and Trident training facilities (TTFs).  These are necessary to ensure ship control system can be maintained and crews are trained on new ship control systems.

[P40A / HH009 EQUIPMENT HM&E & SWS/SS ALTERATION]: This provides for the replacement of obsolete equipment on board of OHIO Class Submarines and at dedicated Shore Support Facilities (TLCSF, TRITRAFAC (B), NAVIMFAC (B), TRITRAFAC (KB), TRIREFFAC (KB), Major Shore Spares (MSS)).  These alterations are necessary in order to replace obsolete/outdated equipment with new equipment to maintain or increase mission capabilities, replace or modify components/systems which have proven to be unreliable, correct design and safety problems and reduce fleet maintenance burdens.  Funds provide for multiple efforts to ensure that the OHIO Class Ship Control Subsystem, both hardware and software components, support the extended life of the OHIO Class submarine platforms.  In FY99 and again in FY06 a NUWC KEYPORT study identified a number of obsolete electronic components in the Ship Control Station (27 out of 107) that are no longer available. The FY06 study recommended that the Ship Control ISEA develop and execute a program that would address the near term obsolescence issues and ensure the continued availability of the subsystem in the out years.  Alterations and actions are done at the lowest practicable and authorized level (taking into consideration urgency, priority, capability, capacity and cost).  Alterations to OHIO Class Submarines are scheduled for accomplishment at the TRIREFFAC, Kings Bay, NAVIMFAC, Bangor, and at Naval Shipyards during Depot Availabilities.  This requires equipment procurement and installation, technical planning, training, and associated resources.  This line provides for material procurement necessary to install the required alterations to OHIO Class Submarines.  Commencing in FY19 funding is provided for upgrading Laboratory facilities at Electric Boar Corporation  and Naval Undersea Warfare Center Newport Rhode Island and at the Trident Training Facilities in Kings Bay Georgia and Bangor Washington.  This upgrade is required so the Ship Control  Laboratory facilities and the Trident Training Facilities are current with installed Ohio Class Ship Control Systems.  This upgrade completes in FY21. 
                                                                                                               
Additionally, this line provides for the utilization of specially trained and dedicated installation teams to ensure accelerated and correct installation of complex and high priority alterations within specific time frames.  Provided are comprehensive program management and execution, including planning, direction, control, installation, integration, and coordination of specifically selected safety related, mission enhancement or technical HM&E alterations. Starting in FY12, SSBN Strategic Weapon Support Systems (SWSS) OER Upgrades are planned for Ventilation Alarm Monitoring Panel (VAMP) and the Missile Heating and Cooling Proportional Controllers.   Both upgrades are required to support Strategic Systems Programs' Strategic Weapon Systems (SWS) Integration program (Mod6/Mod7) which replaces the current Launcher, Fire Control and Weapons Support electronics.  Starting in FY16, two SSBN/GN OER transducer upgrade programs are planned, one for Hovering Transducers and the second for MDD/MHC Differential Pressure Transducers.  Both transducer types are estimated to be out of spares by 2018 and will require form/fit/function replacement.  The Hovering System on both SSBNs and SSGNs is experiencing obsolescence issues due to aging technology and terminated vendor component production as of 2000.  The Missile Drying and Dehumidification (MDD) system and Missile Heating and Cooling (MHC) system on both SSBNs and SSGNs provides a stable temperature and humidity environment for the missile tubes, and has similar obsolescence issues, with terminated vendor component production as of 2009. Starting in FY19, the SSBN Strategic Weapon Support Systems (SWSS) program includes a Sustainability effort, which maintains the SWSS surveillance, modernization and obsolescence management program.  This line monitors and predicts SWSS obsolescence issues and plans for program modernization to address predicted obsolescence, reliability or maintainability issues to ensure OHIO class submarines continue to meet mission requirements to end of life until replaced by the COLUMBIA Class.  Items anticipated may include; Harvesting Critical Components, Reverse Engineering, Form-Fit-Function replacements, providing lifetime buys, providing component-level SHIPALTs (reactive).

[P40A / HH012 EQUIPMENT HM&E TRIDENT ENGINGEERING AVAILABILITY]: TRIDENT Engineered Availability (EA) support funding is required to provide replacement and contingency material to support the critical path schedule during the SSBN 726 Class Submarine Engineered Availabilities (EAs) commencing in FY93 and continuing through the operational life of the submarine.  This program also provides funding for Quality Assurance (QA) oversight and certification by Supervisor Of Shipbuilding, Groton (SOS Groton) of  SHIPALTS performed by Electric Boat Corporation (EB), provides funding to the Planning Yard for Configuration Record change and Liaison Action Request processing, and Selected Record Drawings mark ups for SHIPALT-related work, accomplishment of availability work package requirements assigned to the Planning Yard such as Design Review hanger inspections, Integrated Logistic Support product updates, and Configuration Overhaul Planning Product development and distribution for each availability, and funding for NUWC Newport system-level final end-to-end certification test support and deck plate coordination of Alteration Installation Team (AIT) work during  Engineered Refueling Overhauls (ERO), Extended Refit Periods (ERPs), and Maintenance & Modernization  Periods (MMPs).

[P40A / HH0GN SSGN MODIFICATIONS]: Provides for procurement of SSGN unique system components that will be installed during planned modernization periods.  Also provides funding to perform integrated testing of these unique systems to ensure satisfactory operation with other HM&E and Combat Systems.  Funds are provided for procurement of Submarine Special Operations Forces (SOF) unique system components that will be installed during planned modernization periods.

[P40A / SOF HH0GN]: Funds are provided for installation of Submarine Special Operations Forces (SOF) unique system components. Starting in FY19, additional funding is needed for the Modernized Dry Deck Shelter (DDS) Project and will be used to complete the SHIPALT production or Initial Fit-up of the Modernized DDS on the target (yet to be defined) VA Class host submarine.

[P40A / SWSS VAMP & Proportional Controllers]: Strategic Weapons System Support Systems (SWSS) OER issues involving the Ventilation Alarm and Monitoring Panel (VAMP) and the Missile Heating and Cooling Proportional Controllers. Both upgrades are required to support Strategic Programs' SWS Integration program (Mod6/Mod7) which replaces the current Launcher, Fire Control and Weapons Support electronics.

Justification.val:
FY19 growth in this line is due to procurement and installation of OHIO CLASS Ship Control Station Obsolete Equipment Replacement (SCS OER).  In FY18 to FY19 the number of procurements increases from 1 to 3 and Ship installations increase from 3 to 4.  

FY19 includes installation of shore based systems, including associated design and engineering, at maintenance activities (LAB) and Trident training facilities (TTFs).  These are necessary to ensure ship control system can be maintained and crews are trained on new ship control systems.

Starting in FY19, the SSBN Strategic Weapon Support Systems (SWSS) program includes a Sustainability effort, which maintains the SWSS surveillance, modernization and obsolescence management program.

FY19 increase for SOF ALTS represents additional funding for enhanced SOF capability and will be used for dry deck shelter fit up.

Both transducer types are estimated to be out of spares by 2018 and will require form/fit/function replacement.  The Hovering System on both SSBNs and SSGNs is experiencing obsolescence issues due to aging technology and terminated vendor component production as of 2000.  The Missile Drying and Dehumidification (MDD) system and Missile Heating and Cooling (MHC) system on both SSBNs and SSGNs provides a stable temperature and humidity environment for the missile tubes, and has similar obsolescence issues, with terminated vendor component production as of 2009.
Name.val: 1.2) SWSS SSBN/SSGN Hovering System DP Transducers

Name.@footnote: Ship Control Station OER Material funds identified are for ancillary material required to set up for and support installations. Starting in FY16, these funds are moved from installation to procurement and shown as separate line items to better reflect the required funding profile.

The SCS OER Lab/TTF Equip Upgrade is required to ensure shore maintenance and training facility equipment is similar to ship installation in order support operational issues and ensure training  at the TTFs  matches the latest installed configuration of Ship Control Systems in the fleet.

Name.val: 2) HH012 EQUIPMENT HM&E TRIDENT ENGINGEERING AVAILABILITY

ModificationTitle.val: EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC

Title.val: EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC

Name.val: 1.1.1) EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC

Description.val:
SSBN Ship Control Obsolete Equipment Replacement - Perform multiple efforts to ensure that the OHIO Class Ship Control Subsystem, both hardware and software components, support the extended life of the OHIO Class submarine platforms. 

Note:  Production lead-time for Ship Control System OER is 17 months except for the 2 units procured in FY12.  These units in addition to the normal procurement lead-time will be used in the testing and certification program  of the design of this safety of ship system.  This testing and certification adds an additional 22 months of lead-time.  These two units procured in FY12 have a total lead-time of 39 months and will be installed in FY16.

[EQUIPMENT HM&E SWS/SS ALTERATION SCS SSBN/SSGN PROC] Installations of this SHIPALT are accomplished during SSBN refits, SSBN Extended Refit Periods (ERP), SSGN Major Maintenance Periods (MMP), and SSBN Engineered Refueling Overhauls (ERO). Installations do not complete until the availability completes. Thus the installation duration ranges from 90 days for refit installations to 821 days for ERO installations. By design, Ship Control ShipAlt TRID 588B is conjunctive with SSBN Modernization ShipAlt TRID601, which upgrades SSBNs to TI-16 sonar/fire control systems.  The TI-16 fielding plan was accelerated by OPNAV and sonar/fire control PARMs.  This additional funding for Ship Control ShipAlt TRID 588B allows accelerating installations into FY19, FY21 & FY22 to match the current TI-16 installation scheduled for SSBNs.  

Installation costs vary due to the number of installations, location and type of installation, e.g. ship or facility.

Procurement lead time for SCS OER equipment is  17 months.  The three procurements in  FY19 support installations in 4th quarter FY20 (1 install) and 2nd quarter FY21 (2 installs) based on ship schedules.

[SCS SSBN/SSGN INSTALLATION DSA] DSA costs vary due to the number of installations, location and type of installation, e.g. ship or facility.
